dxf2svg.util
Class HeaderProcessor

java.lang.Object
  dxf2svg.util.Processor
      dxf2svg.util.HeaderProcessor
public final class HeaderProcessor
extends Processor

This class reads the container (Vector) of variables from the DXF header and populates variables that will be useful for generating the SVG. This class could become quite big if you implemented the complete DXF variable set as AutoCAD defines some 70 variables.

Version:
1.60 - April 14, 2005
Author:
Andrew Nisbet

Constructor Detail

HeaderProcessor

public HeaderProcessor()
Default constructor just sets the VERBOSE mode for activity logging.

Method Detail

process

public void process(DxfElementPair pair)
Processes the ElementPairs list (Vector) and populates key SVG variables. All the header ElementPairs are placed within a Vector and the Vector is traversed to extract useful information to be used later during the SVG building process. Much of the information inside the header of the DXF is current application state information and is not required.

Overrides:
process in class Processor

finishObject

protected void finishObject()
Finishes the object collection.

Overrides:
finishObject in class Processor

getLtScale

public final double getLtScale()
Returns the Global LTSCALE for the DXF

getLimitsMinX

public final double getLimitsMinX()
The X value drawing limits lower-left corner in WCS. The difference between Limits and Extends is extends is the point just beyond the outer most object in a drawing and the limits are set by the user to include only the image data of interest; like a view port.

getLimitsMinY

public final double getLimitsMinY()
The Y value drawing limits lower-left corner in WCS.

getLimitsMaxX

public final double getLimitsMaxX()
The X value drawing limits upper-right corner in WCS.

getLimitsMaxY

public final double getLimitsMaxY()
The Y value drawing limits upper-right corner in WCS.
